skill.name: nano-banana-builder
skill.description: Build full-stack web applications powered by Google Gemini's Nano Banana & Nano Banana Pro image generation APIs. Use when creating Next.js image generators, editors, galleries, or any web app that integrates gemini-2.5-flash-image or gemini-3-pro-image-preview models. Covers React components, server actions, API routes, storage, rate limiting, and production deployment patterns.
skill.summary: Build full-stack web applications powered by Google Gemini's Nano Banana & Nano Banana Pro image gen...
skill.author: CesarAugustusGroB

security_audit.summary: Prompt-based documentation skill containing only markdown files and TypeScript code examples. No executable code, no scripts, no network calls, no filesystem access beyond its own files. Pure documentation for building web apps with Google Gemini APIs.

content.user_title: Build web apps with Gemini Nano Banana
content.value_statement: Creating image generation web apps with Google Gemini requires understanding conversational AI patterns, rate limits, and storage strategies. This skill provides production-ready code patterns for Next.js applications with Gemini Nano Banana APIs.
actual_capabilities: Generate images using gemini-2.5-flash-image and gemini-3-pro-image-preview models
Build Next.js server actions and API routes for image generation
Implement iterative image editing with multi-turn conversations
Configure storage with Vercel Blob or S3/R2
Set up rate limiting with Upstash Redis
Create React client components with chat-based interfaces
limitations: Only supports Google Gemini image generation models (gemini-2.5-flash-image, gemini-3-pro-image-preview)
Does not generate actual images itself - provides code patterns only
Requires external API keys (GEMINI_API_KEY) to function
Does not include authentication or user management systems

use_cases.title: Image Generator Apps
use_cases.description: Build Next.js applications that generate images from text prompts using Gemini Nano Banana APIs.

use_cases.title: Production API Backends
use_cases.description: Create server-side APIs with proper rate limiting, storage, and error handling for image generation services.

use_cases.title: Iterative Editing Tools
use_cases.description: Implement multi-turn image editing experiences where users refine images through conversation.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Generator
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a Next.js image generator using gemini-2.5-flash-image with a server action and a React client component. Include environment setup instructions.

prompt_templates.title: Iterative Editor
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an iterative image editor with Next.js that allows users to upload an image and describe edits conversationally using gemini-3-pro-image-preview.

prompt_templates.title: Full-Stack App
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a complete full-stack image generation app with Vercel Blob storage, Upstash Redis rate limiting, and a gallery view of generated images.

prompt_templates.title: Batch Processing
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement batch image generation with progress tracking, error handling with retries, and cost optimization using Nano for drafts and Pro for final output.

output_examples.input: Build a Next.js image generator with gemini-2.5-flash-image
output: React component with useChat hook for conversational interface
Loading states and error handling patterns

best_practices: Use gemini-2.5-flash-image for rapid iterations and gemini-3-pro-image-preview for quality final output
Store images in object storage (Vercel Blob/S3) rather than base64 in databases
Implement rate limiting before hitting API quotas to avoid 429 errors in production
anti_patterns: Hardcoding API keys in client-side code instead of using server actions
Using incorrect model names like gemini-2.5-flash-preview-05-20 or gemini-pro-vision
Generating images on every keystroke without debouncing or user confirmation

faq.question: Which Gemini model should I use for image generation?
faq.answer: Use gemini-2.5-flash-image for speed and iterations, or gemini-3-pro-image-preview for quality and text rendering.

faq.question: How do I handle rate limits with Gemini APIs?
faq.answer: Implement rate limiting with Upstash Redis or in-memory counters. Set reasonable request windows (10 requests/minute for free tier).

faq.question: Can I use this skill with other AI providers?
faq.answer: No. This skill specifically covers Google Gemini image generation APIs. Use other skills for OpenAI DALL-E or Stability AI.

faq.question: Is my API key stored or transmitted anywhere?
faq.answer: No. The skill is documentation-only. Your API key stays in your environment variables and is only used by your application code.

faq.question: Why am I getting 429 errors?
faq.answer: You have exceeded rate limits. Implement rate limiting, reduce request frequency, or upgrade your Gemini API tier for higher quotas.

faq.question: How do I deploy these applications?
faq.answer: Deploy to Vercel for best integration with Blob storage. Configure environment variables in your deployment dashboard.
